Description: Fragment of plain weave, undyed, cream wool with a square tapestry panel (b) sewn to it; (a) Warp/weft: S-spun, c.12 tpc; Edges: cut or ragged; Sewing: (b) sewn to (a) with overcasting in S-spun Z ply linen thread; (b) is a square tapestry panel (plied warp threads) with a simplified design; a frame of red, yellow, white, light blue and green flowers on a dark blue ground surrounds a central red square with an abstract motif; Warp: linen, S-spun, c.10 tpc; Weft: wool and some linen, c.60 tpc; Edges: two selvedges with two cut edges turned under;
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Probably from a garment; (b) woven to be applied to another textile by sewing; Edges cut since excavation; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (20.9.1989)
Condition: Fair; Unknown date stuck to sticky net; (b) one corner missing.
